gurmukhi: surpur nwir bDwvw mwnw ]bir hY Awj mhw suBtn ko smr suXMbr jwnw ]
transliteration: Surpur Daar(i) Badhaavaa Maanaa|| Bar(i) Hai Aaj Mahaa Soubhatan Ko Samara Suyaanbar Jaanaa||
translation: The heavenly damsels began to sing songs of felicitation thinking that they would be wedding the great warriors in that swayamvara of war;

gurmukhi: liK hY eyk pwie TwFI hm ijm ijm suBt juJY hY ]iqm iqm Gwl pwlkI Awpn Amr purI lY jYhY ]
transliteration: Lakh(i) Hai Ek Paae Thaadhi Ham Jim Jim Soubhat Jujhai Hai|| Tim Tim Dhaal Paalkiaapan Amar Purilai Jaihai||
translation: That they would stand on one foot and observe the warriors fighting and immediately take them to heaven, causing them to sit in their palanquins;

gurmukhi: cMdn cwir icqR cMdn ky cMcl AMg cVwaU ]jw idn smr suXMbr kr kY prm ipArvih pwaU ]
transliteration: Channdan Cdaar(i) Chitra Channdan Ke Channdhal An Chadaaoo|| Jaa Din Samara Suyanbar Kar Kai Param Piarvah(i) Paaoo||
translation: The day on which they would come into contact with their beloved one, on that day they would decorated with sandal their pretty limbs;

gurmukhi: qwN idn dyh sPl kir mwno AMg sINgwr DroN ]jw idn smr suXMbr sKI rI pwrs nwQ broN ]34]108]
transliteration: Taan Din Deh Saphal Kar(i) Maano An Seengadr Ddaron|| Jaa Din Samara Suyanbar Sakhiripaaras Naath Badon||34||108||
translation: O friend ! the day on which they would wed Parasnath, on that day they would consider their body as fruitful and then embellish it.34.108.

gurmukhi: chu ids mwrU Sbd bjy ]gih gih gdw gurj gwjI sB hT rx Awn gjy ]
transliteration: Chahu Dis Maroo Shabad Baje|| Gadh Gadh Gadaa Guraj Gadjisabh Hath Ran Aan Gadaa||
translation: The thundering horns were blown in all the four directions and the warriors holding their maces stood firmly and persistently in the battlefield;

gurmukhi: bwn kmwn kiRpwn sYhQI bwx pRXoG clwey ]jwnuk mhw myG bUMdn jXoN ibisK bXUih brswey ]
transliteration: Baan Kamaan Kridaan Saihathibaan Prayogh Chadhaae|| Jaanouk Mahaa Megh Boondan Jyon Bisikh Byooh(i) Barsaae||
translation: The arrows, bows, swords, lances etc. were used; the clusters of arrows were discharged in showers like the rain-drops from the clouds;

gurmukhi: ctpt crm brm sB byDy stpt pwr prwny ]Ktpt srb BUim ky byDy nwgn log isDwny ]
transliteration: Chatpat Charam Baram Sabh Bedhe Satpat Paar Paraane|| Khatpat Sarab Bhoom(i) Ke Bedhe Naagad Log Sidhaane||
translation: The arrows piercing the armours and leather penetrated directly to the other side; and even went to the nether-world after piercing the earth;

gurmukhi: Jmkq KVg kwF nwnw ibiD sYQI suBt clwvq ]jwnuk pRgt bwt sur pur kI nIky hiRdy idKwvq ]35]109]
transliteration: Jhamkat Khadag Kaadh Naanaa Bidh(i) Saithisoubhat Chadaavat|| Jaanouk Pragad Baat Sur Kineeke Hride Dikhaavat||35||109||
translation: The warriors struck the gleaming daggers and lances and these weapons looked like piercing the hearts and showing them the path to heaven.35.109.

gurmukhi: bwnn byDy Aimq sMinAwsI ]qy qj dyh nyh sMpiq ko Bey s√çrg ky bwsI ]
transliteration: Baanan Bedhe Amit Sanniaasee|| Te Taj Deh Neh Sanpat(i) Ko Bhae Svarag Ke Baasee||
translation: Innumerable Sannyasis were pierced with the arrows and they all became the residents of heaven, forsaking the attachment of wealth and property;

gurmukhi: crm brm rQ Dujw pqwkw bhu ibiD kwt igrwey ]soBq Bey ieMdR pur jm pur sur pur inrK ljwey ]
transliteration: Charam Baram Rath Dhujaa Pataakaa Bahu Bidh(i) Kaat Giraae|| Sobhat Bhae Indra Pur Jam Pur Sur Pur Nirakh Lajaae||
translation: The armours, banners, chariots and flags etc. were cut down and caused to fall; they all extended the glory of heaven and the abodes of Indra and Yama;

gurmukhi: BUKn bsqR rMg rMgn ky Cut Cut BUm igry ]jnuk ASok bwgu idvpq ky puhp bsMiq Jry ]
transliteration: Bhookhan Bastra Ran Ranad Ke Chhout Chhout Bhoom Gire|| Janouk Ashok Baag(u) Divpat Ke Puhap Basant(i) Jdare||
translation: Their multi-coloured garments fell on the ground; they appeared like flowers dropping down in spring in Ashok Vatika;

gurmukhi: kit kit igry gjn kuMBsQl mukqw ibQuir pry ]jwnuk AMmiRq kuMf muK CUty jlkn suBg Jry ]36]110]
transliteration: Kattee Kattee Gire Gadan Dounbh-sathak Mouktaa Bithur(i) Dare|| Jaanouk Anmrit Kound Moukh Chhodhte Jalkan Soubhag Jdare||36||110||
translation: The trunks of the elephants and the pearl-necklaces were lying scattered on the earth and appeared like the scattered water drops from the pool of ambrosia.36.110.
